column1: These occur due to a hole or tear in the retina.
If holes or tears in the retina are found before the retina detaches, the eye doctor can close the holes using a laser.
- You are then positioned so the gas bubble floats up to the hole in the retina and pushes it back into place.
The following procedures are done in a hospital or outpatient surgery center: - The scleral buckle method indents the wall of the eye inward so that it meets the hole in the retina.
- The vitrectomy procedure uses very small devices inside the eye to release tension on the retina.
Most vitrectomies are done with numbing medicine while you are awake.
Surgery can still be done to prevent total blindness.

Risks for retinal detachment surgery include: - Bleeding - Detachment that is not completely fixed (may require more surgeries) - Increase in eye pressure (elevated intraocular pressure) - Infection General anesthesia may be needed.
